title: BikePark Wales Weekend
tagline: Two days of downhill at the UK's best bike park
suitableFor: Intermediate to advanced mountain bikers comfortable riding blue and red graded trails. Good level of fitness required for multiple uplift runs.
notSuitableFor: Beginner mountain bikers with little to no experience on graded trails, or those with limited fitness.

stops.title: BikePark Wales Uplift Session
stops.description: Start the day with the uplift service, maximising your downhill runs on a variety of trails. Explore blue, red, and black graded runs based on your ability.

wetAlt.title: BikePark Wales Cafe & Skills Area
wetAlt.description: Practice skills on the pump track and smaller features, or enjoy the cafe while waiting out the rain.

budgetAlt.title: Pedal-Up Session
budgetAlt.description: Skip the uplift and pedal to the top of the trails for a free workout (allow extra time).

stops.title: BikePark Wales Cafe
stops.description: Fuel up with burgers, sandwiches, and hot drinks at the on-site cafe.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Gethin Woodland Park
budgetAlt.description: Picnic spot with views a short walk from the BikePark Wales parking.

stops.title: Afternoon Coaching Session
stops.description: Improve your skills with a 2-hour coaching session focusing on cornering, jumping, or technical trail riding.

wetAlt.title: Bike Maintenance Workshop
wetAlt.description: Learn basic bike maintenance skills at the BikePark Wales workshop.

budgetAlt.title: Trail Exploration
budgetAlt.description: Explore less-ridden trails at BikePark Wales independently. Check trail map for suitable options.

stops.title: The New Inn, Pontsticill
stops.description: Traditional pub with comfortable rooms, perfect for relaxing after a day on the trails.

budgetAlt.title: Camping at Pontsticill Reservoir
budgetAlt.description: Wild camping around Pontsticill Reservoir (check local regulations and leave no trace).

stops.title: The New Inn Restaurant
stops.description: Enjoy a hearty pub meal at The New Inn's restaurant.

budgetAlt.title: Cook your own meal at campsite/accommodation
budgetAlt.description: Bring camping stove or use provided facilities.

stops.title: BikePark Wales Technical Trails
stops.description: Focus on the more technical trails, challenging yourself with rock gardens, drops, and steeper gradients.

wetAlt.title: BikePark Wales Cafe & Skills Area
wetAlt.description: Practice skills on the pump track and smaller features, or enjoy the cafe while waiting out the rain.

budgetAlt.title: Pedal-Up Session
budgetAlt.description: Skip the uplift and pedal to the top of the trails for a free workout (allow extra time).

stops.title: The Red House, Merthyr Tydfil
stops.description: A riverside cultural centre with a cafe offering light meals and snacks.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at the Red House
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own food on the grounds of the Red House.

stops.title: Final Runs at BikePark Wales
stops.description: Enjoy a final few runs at your favourite trails, taking in the scenery and pushing your limits one last time.

wetAlt.title: BikePark Wales Workshop/Cafe
wetAlt.description: Further skills session or just relax at the cafe.

stops.title: Bike Wash & Pack Up
stops.description: Clean your bike at the BikePark Wales bike wash before packing up for departure.

budgetAlt.title: DIY Bike Clean
budgetAlt.description: Use your own water bottle/hose to clean down your bike

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Wales weather is unpredictable. Pack for all conditions, including rain, even in summer. Check the forecast before you go.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy on the A470, especially during peak season and weekends. Allow extra travel time. Parking at BikePark Wales can fill up quickly, arrive early.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Uplift passes and coaching sessions at BikePark Wales should be booked in advance, especially during weekends and school holidays. Accommodation should also be pre-booked.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: A good level of fitness is required to fully enjoy the downhill trails. Be prepared for strenuous activity and potential exposure to the elements.
